basics.name: Christopher Nguyen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a rising senior at the University of Hawaii at Manoa majoring in Computer Science with a minor in Business. Before graduating in Spring 2018, I will be interning for IBM in Summer 2017.

interests.name: Software Development, Program Management, and Education

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

highlights: Building a cloud-based service to host and process lunar temperature data from the NASA Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter.
Producing a ‘potential sublimation rate’ map to identify and visualize potential ice deposits on the Moon.
Developed a dependency detection microservice to automate the update, sandbox, and build processes of 3rd party dependencies in Watson Data Platform services.
Wrote RESTful APIs for the dependency detection microservice and documented them using Swagger.
Led team of four through daily standups and playbacks in two week sprints as scrum master.
Worked collaboratively with international development groups to complete comprehensive testing and quality assurance on two major releases.
Built a 72” video wall system using open-source software, IP routing, and seven Raspberry Pis.
Tested PySide2, an open-source	Python	binding	of	Qt,	on	the	MinGW development	environment for	a	Windows	CV	application.
Conducted high-level network assessments for external clients and state agencies.
Developed the front-end for Ditto, a social media startup in the Blue Startups Accelerator Program.
Conducted extensive consumer research using AB testing and Google Analytics on the Ditto app and website.
Refactored a mobile geographic information system (GIS) app to include a parcel data extraction feature using the ArcGIS API.

Developed a cross-platform Customer Relationship Management (CRM) app for iOS and Android using
Cordova, Node.js, and Design Thinking to increase consultant and client interaction by 10%.

work.summary: Computer Science and STEM Mentor under Bebi Davis, PhD of the Kaimuki-McKinley-Roosevelt Complex Area
highlights: Collaborated with 28 schools to develop a 21st-century STEM curriculum which sparked a 48% STEM interest among Hawaii high school students.

Mentored students that totaled $15,000+ in agency awards at the Honolulu District, Hawaii State, and
Intel International Science and Engineering Fair.
Connected high school students with external mentors at the John A. Burns School of Medicine for research-based internships.
Taught English to Kindergarteners and painted an entire school in Tecpan, Guatemala courtesy of the Hamilton Award Scholarship (2013).
Vice President, Vietnamese Student Organization at UH Manoa (VSOUH), 2016-Present
Member, Hawaii Undergraduate Initiative (HUI), 2015-Present
Member, IEEE Student Branch, 2015-2016

awards.title: Computer Science Award
awards.summary: Awarded at the 2014 Hawaii State Science and Engineering Fair for my project, PIPE. See my portfolio site for more details.

awards.title: Best in Computer Science
awards.summary: Awarded at the 2014 Honolulu District Science and Engineering Fair for my project, PIPE. See my portfolio site for more details.

awards.summary: Scholarship award given to 1 Hawaii student attending the University of Hawaii at Manoa http://www.hawaiirotaryyouthfoundation.org/currentrecipients

awards.title: STEM Award
awards.awarder: Pearl Harbor Naval Shipyard and Maintenance Facility
awards.summary: Scholarship award funded by the National Defense Education Program for academic achievement, participation in FIRST robotics, and dedication to STEM

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Academic honor given to students with a 3.5 GPA or above. Semesters Received: Fall 2014, Spring 2015, Fall 2015, Spring 2016, Fall 2016
